name: politico
text:
Trump suggested today that he would send some of the more than 9,000 troops he plans to withdraw from Germany over its eastern border to Poland

https://t.co/byCv9AWHtS

name: politico
text:
The Trump administration’s pledge to protect Covid-19 patients from massive medical bills is falling short for a growing number of survivors who experience long-term complications from the virus

https://t.co/mJQjRF074z

name: politico
text:
John Bolton’s memoir has renewed concerns that Donald Trump undermined his administration’s early attempts to grapple with China’s spreading coronavirus outbreak out of concern for his personal relationship with President Xi Jinping

https://t.co/TpC2gTt8Po

name: politico
text:
Get quick, digestible facts and insights on the news of the day by listening to POLITICO Dispatch. Subscribe now.
https://t.co/DPUpEFlsul https://t.co/6WEXVoTOo6

name: politico
text:
Trump promised to cover the costs for Covid-19 patients. But survivors with long-term symptoms are getting huge bills.

"It's a big mess," says @SusannahLuthi. "We're seeing bills already at tens of thousands of dollars for some of these complications" https://t.co/511TPQdaVj https://t.co/zcO5EUbbD6

name: politico
text:
Patients with and without insurance have already been hit with staggering bills, according to patient advocates. 

That’s because health care providers and insurers are classifying some complications as distinct from the virus during the billing process
https://t.co/mJQjRF074z

name: politico
text:
Private health insurers, including many the White House prodded to waive full treatment costs for Covid patients, haven’t committed to extending those generous coverage policies to patients dealing with virus-related conditions weeks or months later
https://t.co/mJQjRF074z

name: politico
text:
Insurers like Cigna are waiving costs for these post-viral health problems — but only as long as the patients’ doctors explicitly link them to Covid-19 on their medical bills

https://t.co/mJQjRF074z

name: politico
text:
Patients whose doctors fail to may be exposed to staggering charges: One woman reported getting at least $65,000 in bills for an eight-day stay in the hospital for Covid-19 and complications that included a colon infection

https://t.co/mJQjRF074z

name: politico
text:
Poland is making “vigilant efforts to uphold the rule of law,” President Trump said during a press conference after meeting his Polish counterpart, Andrzej Duda, at the White House today

https://t.co/GPugOLUaD0

name: politico
text:
Tri-State governors today announced mandatory quarantines of Floridians, and others, coming to their states. 

The news came after Florida hit an all-time high in new positive coronavirus cases: 5,508, exceeding by 36% a previous high four days earlier
https://t.co/kVT1sBA8yE

name: politico
text:
Progressive leaders on and off Capitol Hill are emboldened after Tuesday’s high-stakes primaries, with the success of a slew of hand-picked candidates signaling the left is far from finished in the battle for the Democratic Party’s future

https://t.co/K9hPsXiQBy

name: politico
text:
Dems who were once alarmed that Joe Biden needed to do more are suddenly perfectly happy with a schedule that keeps him as close as possible to his Wilmington, Delaware, home most days.

Only recently has he begun to make forays beyond his own neighborhood
https://t.co/bStuwQgtBt

name: politico
text:

https://t.co/7ZdiUQaEkj

name: politico
text:
The Democratic National Convention in Milwaukee will host Joe Biden, but delegates are encouraged not to attend in person as the party tries to manage holding its marquee event during the coronavirus pandemic

https://t.co/H6t9CJNkpD

name: politico
text:
Three weeks ago, Black voters Tonya Griffith knows were coasting on autopilot during this election year with no feeling of intensity. And then came the killing of George Floyd. “That lit a fire under our ass like nothing I’ve ever seen,” she said

https://t.co/RVpUxtpa81

name: politico
text:
Joe Biden has widened his lead over Donald Trump in Wisconsin and narrowly leads the president in Ohio, according to a pair of polls from two key swing states in the Midwest

https://t.co/RmEG2GCF7h

name: politico
text:
Opinion: We are probably headed to the ugliest electoral smashup since 1876.

If the election is close, the aftermath will be a norm-busting extravaganza of conspiracy theories, lawsuits and, at the very least, threats to take it to the streets
https://t.co/0rHrXL9RLg

name: politico
text:
The coronavirus pandemic is forcing Berlin to acknowledge what some European thinkers have been saying for years: The EU won’t survive without more forceful German leadership

name: politico
text:

name: politico
text: The debacle that unfolded at Trump's comeback rally in Oklahoma has raised the stakes for the Jacksonville convention in August https://t.co/dzaZQe3Je6

name: politico
text:
Attorney General Bill Barr announced Friday that Geoffrey Berman, the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York, was stepping down from his job, effective immediately. 

There was just one hiccup: Berman hadn’t actually resigned.
https://t.co/xZ3q75PbUB

name: politico
text: Three and a half years into his presidency we know so much that it raises the question: What do we not yet know about Donald Trump? https://t.co/Z10sNVBmxO

name: politico
text: Across a half-dozen key states where Donald Trump prevailed in 2016, the president now trails Joe Biden by an average of 9 percentage points https://t.co/TrgVV7UTSv

text: A new lawsuit is demanding details on how the White House censored John Bolton’s book and whether the passages officials wanted deleted were true national security secrets https://t.co/PeGE07RGql

name: politico
text:
We are roughly two months ahead of the party’s nominating conventions, and, like with all else in today’s politics, Democrats and Republicans are employing diametrically different strategies

https://t.co/2Ucn9eBOdT

name: politico
text: BREAKING: Another 1.5 million workers applied for jobless benefits last week. More than 19.5 million people remain on unemployment rolls. https://t.co/5JyiCo5HUH

name: politico
text: The U.S. is experiencing its highest levels of unemployment since the Great Depression, even as businesses begin to reopen. More than 20 million American workers are receiving jobless benefits. https://t.co/ujIbBacpz7

name: politico
text: The burden is disproportionately falling on women, who are more likely to have been laid off, to have left the labor market or to be considering quitting their jobs so they can manage family responsibilities https://t.co/ujIbBacpz7

name: politico
text: The future of liberal democracy is under threat because of the Covid-19 pandemic, numerous prominent figures argued in an open letter published Thursday https://t.co/lcJsN5oTG9

name: politico
text:
RT @davidalim: The United States is now seeing a dramatic upswing in daily confirmed cases driven by many states in the South and West including Texas, Florida and California. 

Yesterday, 38,672 new cases were tallied by the @COVID19Tracking Project – a record.The United States is now seeing a dramatic upswing in daily confirmed cases driven by many states in the South and… https://t.co/rUWUTorBFq

name: politico
text: On Monday, President Trump signed an executive order suspending the entry of foreign workers seeking H-1B, J and L visas through year’s end https://t.co/ObvkOFnoDi

name: politico
text: The order says such visa holders are a “significant threat to employment opportunities for Americans” affected by Covid-19. The announcement is sending shockwaves through the Chinese diaspora. https://t.co/ObvkOFnoDi

name: politico
text: Experts we talked to warn the move is self-destructive. More in today's "China Watcher" newsletter 👉 https://t.co/ObvkOFnoDi https://t.co/pklQULSogG

name: politico
text: Carly Fiorina had been open to supporting the president’s reelection effort as recently as December 2019. Today she said she'll vote for Joe Biden over Donald Trump. https://t.co/pFL1brEfGo https://t.co/Is6KmsUsZK

text:
